tool.name: NRT_Create_Monitoring_Areas

param.name: in_feat
param.dialogReference:
Set the input monitoring area feature class to create new monitoring areas in to. The feature class must be created prior via the Create Project tool and be named "monitoring_areas".

Any feature class not created by the aforementioned tool will be rejected.

param.name: in_new_feat
param.dialogReference:
Click the pencil icon to begin drawing a new polygon on the fly. It is recommended that your monitoring areas are at least 30 square metres in area to ensure at least one pixel is captured.

Note: only one polygon will be accepted per run of this tool, so please create only one polygon for each monitoring area at a time.

param.name: in_area_id
param.dialogReference: Set a unique monitoring area identifier. For example: A01, MonArea02, etc. Avoid using special characters and spaces. Duplicate values will be rejected.

param.name: in_platform
param.dialogReference:
Select between Landsat or Sentinel satellite platforms as a source of monitoring data for a monitoring area.

Landsat provides 35+ years of archived data at 30 m resolution, whereas Sentinel provides 10 m resolution imagery from 2016 onwards.

param.name: in_s_year
param.dialogReference:
Set the starting year of the "pre-impact" period. The harmonic regression model will be trained entirely on this period.

As an example, if vegetation was in good, stable condition for two or more years, you might want to start somewhere at the beginning of the stable period. This period can be changed later on using the "NRT Modify Monitoring Areas" tool if the initial period is poorly selected.

Note: a period of two or more years (between start and end period) is required.

param.name: in_e_year
param.dialogReference:
Set the ending year of the "pre-impact" period. The harmonic regression model will be trained entirely on this period.

As an example, if vegetation was in good, stable condition for two or more years, you might want to end somewhere at the end of the stable period. This period can be changed later on using the "NRT Modify Monitoring Areas" tool if the initial period is poorly selected.

Note: a period of two or more years (between start and end period) is required. Additionally, note that the model may not finish training exactly on the given end year. If more (or less) data is required, it will stop when optimal.

param.name: in_veg_idx
param.dialogReference:
Set the vegetation index used to derive vegetation "greeness".

Options include:

- NDVI

- MAVI

-kNDVI

param.name: in_persistence
param.dialogReference:
Persistence is best considered as the minimum number of outliers needed to register a deviation. In practical terms, a lower persistence will register a deviation quicker than a higher persistence, but will be prone to more noise (i.e., minor deviations).

A value between 0.2 and 0.5 has been found to work best, but experimentation is required.

param.name: in_min_conseqs
param.dialogReference:
Rule 1 counts the number of consecutive increases or decreases in vegetation deviation. An alarm will only be triggered once a certain number of consecutive increases or decreases has been reached, as set here.

For example, if a value of 2 is used, an alarm will not be signaled until that decline has occurred two times in a row. A higher value will mean an alarm is only triggered when number of on-going decline has been recorded, whereas a lower value will trigger alarms very early on when trajectory trends in a specific direction.

param.name: in_inc_plateaus
param.dialogReference:
By default, the rule 1 trigger system does not include "plateau values" (i.e., a period of several samples that were the exact same deviation value neither up or down).

Set this to Yes to include plateaus in the consecutive alarm trigger calculation.

param.name: in_num_zones
param.dialogReference: Rule 3 is used to detect sharp "spikes" in value jumps, if detected. The value here determines how many zones must be jumped before a trigger is sent. The smaller the value here, the smaller the spike will be. Set this value higher for significant spikes in vegetation values.

param.name: in_ruleset
param.expression: 1 and 2 or 3 | 1 Only | 2 Only | 3 Only | 1 and 2 | 1 and 3 | 2 and 3 | 1 or 2 | 1 or 3 | 2 or 3 | 1 and 2 and 3 | 1 or 2 and 3 | 1 or 2 or 3
param.dialogReference:
The ruleset sets the unique combinations of rules to be used for trigger alarms. The available rules include:

  • 1 Only: only rule 1 is considered

  • 2 Only: only rule 2 is considered

  • 3 Only: only rule 3 is considered

  • 1 and 2 : rule 1 and 2 are combined and considered

  • 1 and 3: rule 1 and 3 are combined and considered

  • 2 and 3: rule 2 and 3 are combined and considered

  • 1 or 2 : rule 1 or 2 are considered

  • 1 or 3 : rule 1 or 3 are considered

  • 2 or 3 : rule 2 or 3 are considered

  • 1 and 2 and 3: rules 1, 2 and 3 are combined and considered

  • 1 or 2 and 3: rules 1 or (2 and 3) are considered

  • 1 and 2 or 3: rules (1 and 2) or 3 are considered

  • 1 or 2 or 3: rules 1 or 2 or 3 are considered

The default is 1 and 2 or 3.

param.name: in_alert_user
param.dialogReference: If set to Yes, the user will obtain an email alert if an email address is provided below. Otherwise, no email will be sent.

param.name: in_alert_direction
param.expression: Decline only (any) | Incline only (any) | Incline only (+ zones only) | Decline only (- zones only) | Incline or Decline (any) | Incline or Decline (+/- zones only)
param.dialogReference: Users can decided whether an email address is sent only when trend is positive (incline), negative (decline) or any direction (both).

param.name: in_email
param.dialogReference: Set the email address of the person who will receive trigger alerts for this monitoring area.

param.name: in_ignore_user
param.dialogReference: If set to Yes, this monitoring area will be ignored during monitoring. Useful if the monitoring area is no longer being monitored.

tool.summary:
Use this tool to begin creating unique monitoring area polygons anywhere in Australia. Draw boundaries around vegetation and assign unique information to that area for monitoring purposes.

Note: this tool requires that a project geodatabase has been created with the Create Project tool. Additionally, only the "monitoring_areas" feature created from that tool will be accepted in this tool.
